Please use "fork" attribute in java target, otherwise the arguments of JVM will be ignored. 

	<java classname="org.eclipse.birt.doc.romdoc.RomDoc" fork="true">
	        <arg value="${romdoc.output.dir}"/>
		<arg value="${basedir}/romdoc/docs" />
			<classpath>
			    <pathelement path="romdoc/bin"/>
			    <pathelement path="${build.dir}"/>
			    <pathelement path="${core.dir}\core.jar" />
				<pathelement path="${codec.dir}\lib\commons-codec-1.3.jar" />				
				<fileset dir="${sac.dir}">
					<include name="lib/*.jar" />
				</fileset>
				<fileset dir="${eclipse.home}/plugins/">			
					<include name="com.ibm.icu_*.jar"/>			
				</fileset>				
			</classpath>
			<jvmarg value="-Djavax.xml.parsers.SAXParserFactory=${javax.xml.parsers.SAXParserFactory}"/>
		</java>

Due to the change of JDK version(now we use jdk1.5), RomDoc failed again.

Please delete the arguments line:
<jvmarg
value="-Djavax.xml.parsers.SAXParserFactory=${javax.xml.parsers.SAXParserFactory}"/>
in buildmodel.xml, and "fork='true'" can be delete too.
Due to changes in the build environment, reverted all changes.

Verified in daily build 20060613.

Bug closed.
